start: ^Ah, there you are! A fresh recruit for the illustrious Legion XIII Gemina! Congratulations, [player]!
^Thank you! I’m excited to be here!
^You've joined one of the finest legions in all of Rome. I can already see the fire in your eyes—just what we need out there.
^I appreciate that. What’s the situation like?

^Since you are here, I'm gonna tell you something... But listen closely, the situation beyond our borders grows dire. Caesar is rounding up every available soldier, preparing us for a campaign that will test our mettle like never before.
^What do you mean by “test our mettle”?
^Word from scouts tells of unrest among the Gauls, especially near Bibracte. They sense our approach and are rallying their tribes, uniting under a single banner to stand against us.
^Aye, it is. With that being said, do me a favor, will ya?
^Speak to the others—there's wisdom to be gained from the veterans who have seen countless battles. They can teach you more than any training manual.
^Got it! Who should I talk to first?

^Perhaps start with Gaius, the experienced swordsman by the armory. He’s been through more battles than I can count. Or you could seek out Lucius, our strategist over by the maps. They’ll have valuable insights for you.
^I’ll make sure to speak with them. Anything else I should know?
^Just remember, young recruit: knowledge is just as important as skill in the field. Learn from the past, and it will guide you through the future. Once you are done, come back to me.
^Thank you for the advice. I’ll be back soon!
goal_0: ^Ah, a new recruit! Don’t let the weight of your armor drag you down. The key to a good fight is balance and focus.
^Thanks, Gaius! I’ll keep that in mind.
^In battle, it's not just about strength; it's about speed and precision. A swift blade can end a fight before it begins.
^That makes sense. I’ve always believed a quick strike can make all the difference.
^Also, just a piece of advice: never underestimate the Gauls!
^I've faced the Gauls before. They’re fierce and unpredictable. Respect them, or you’ll find yourself overwhelmed.
^I’ll remember that. I’ve heard stories about their tactics.
^Good. Always follow your comrades into battle, and move as a group—never fight alone. You’ll be stronger together.
^I appreciate the advice, Gaius. I’ll be sure to stick with my squad.
^Stay sharp, recruit. You’ve got the potential, but it’s up to you to hone it. Remember, a good soldier is always learning.
^Thanks for the encouragement! I’ll do my best.
goal_1: ^The march to Bibracte will be treacherous. We need to stick together and remain vigilant at all times.
^The Gauls will use every tactic in their book to throw us off balance. Expect ambushes and guerrilla warfare. Knowledge is our greatest weapon.
^Stay informed about troop movements and anything unusual. Every bit of information can save lives.
^We may be outnumbered, but we have training and discipline on our side. Stick to the plan, and we’ll show them the might of Rome.
^Don’t let the numbers fool you. In battle, strategy wins over brute force. Always anticipate their next move.
^And remember, communicate with your fellow soldiers. A unified front is our best defense against the chaos of war.
^Be ready, recruit. We’ll face the Gauls head-on, and I expect nothing less than your full commitment.
goal_2: ^Ah, there you are! I trust you’ve gathered some useful insights from our veterans? They’ve seen battles that would turn a lesser man’s stomach.
^Yes, I learned a lot from both Gaius and Lucius.
^As we prepare to march, I need every soldier ready. We’ll strike hard and fast at Bibracte. Keep your eyes open, and don’t hesitate to report anything unusual.

^This is a critical moment for us. We’re not just fighting for territory; we’re fighting to show Rome's strength. You’ll have a chance to prove yourself out there. I expect you to rise to the occasion!
^I’ll do my best to live up to the Legion’s reputation.
^Now, go prepare yourself. Check your gear, sharpen your blade, and be ready for the command to march. Together, we will demonstrate what Legion XIII Gemina is capable of!
^I’ll get right on it. We won’t disappoint you!
goal_3: ^Soldiers, gather round! I have urgent news from our scouts. They've spotted a group of approximately twenty Gallic soldiers camping in the woods nearby. Their presence poses a risk to our plans.
^Legate Anthony has ordered us to disperse these scouts before they can report our movements to their tribes. We cannot afford any delays.

^[player]!!! This is your moment, recruit. Prove your worth to the Legion XIII Gemina. I want you to take the lead in this operation. You’ll have the opportunity to show your skills in the field and gain the respect of your fellow soldiers.
^I'll lend you 10 of our good men for this operation. I trust you to bring them all back alive for the upcoming battle here in Bibracte.
^Remember, this is not just about strength. Use your wits, coordinate with your comrades, and strike quickly. We need to send a clear message to the Gauls that we will not be trifled with!
^Prepare yourself and gather a small group to assist you. Move swiftly, and return victorious. The eyes of the Legion are upon you!
^I won't let you down! I'll make sure we complete the mission and come back safe.
goal_4: ^Well done, soldier! You've proven yourself out there, and your actions have not gone unnoticed. The strength and discipline you displayed are what make Rome mighty. Consider this a victory worthy of the Legion!
^I appreciate your praise, Centurion. It was a team effort.
^Now, there’s no time to rest on our laurels. The Legate himself, Mark Antony, is expecting you. Head to him at once for a full mission update and to receive your next orders.
^Understood. I’ll make my way to him right away.
^Remember, recruit, your journey has only just begun. Mark Antony will have great plans for you, and your continued success will strengthen our Legion. Stay sharp!
^I won't let you down, Centurion. I’ll report to Mark Antony immediately.
goal_5: ^Well done, soldier. You’ve served the Thirteenth with honor, and your deeds have not gone unnoticed.
^Thank you, Mark Antony. It means a lot coming from you.
^But listen carefully—there’s news from the front. The Gauls have been spotted advancing on Bibracte. We cannot let them gain ground.
^I understand. We’ll be ready to face them.
^We’ll be marching soon to meet them, and we’ll need every legionary ready and prepared.
^I’ll gather my comrades and ensure they’re ready.
^Find your Centurion and deliver this message. Tell him we go to Bibracte, where Rome will once again make her mark.
^Go now, and be swift! The future of the Legion depends on our actions today.
^I won’t let you down, Mark Antony. I’ll deliver the message right away.
goal_6: ^So, the Gauls march to Bibracte, do they? It seems they’ve forgotten the bite of Roman steel.
^No matter—we’ll be there to remind them.
^You’ve done well, soldier. Thanks to you, we’re one step closer to victory.
^Prepare yourself; the Thirteenth marches soon, and we’ll need every able man ready for what lies ahead.
^Dismissed. Ready yourself for battle—and know that Rome is watching.
^I won’t let you down, Centurion. We’ll make Rome proud!
exhaust_talk: ^Hm? What do you want? didn't I assign you to talk to the Veterans?
exhaust_mission: ^Legionnaire! I tasked you to disperse the Gallic scouts in the forest near this camp! What are you doing!?!
exhaust_requirement: ^Do you have the intel about the camp?
